etomica.space

Class BoundaryDeformablePeriodic

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.space.Boundary
      • etomica.space.BoundaryDeformablePeriodic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBoundary, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoundaryDeformableLattice, BoundaryDeformablePeriodicSwitch

    public class BoundaryDeformablePeriodic
extends Boundary
    Boundary shaped as an arbitrary parallelepiped. Applicable only for a 2D or 3D spaces.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      BoundaryDeformablePeriodic(ISpace _space)
      Make a cubic boundary with edges of length equal to the default boxSize and periodic in every direction.

      Make a cubic boundary of specified edge length and periodicity.
      BoundaryDeformablePeriodic(ISpace space, IVector[] vex)
      Make a parallelepiped boundary of specified shape and periodicity.

      • BoundaryDeformablePeriodic

        public BoundaryDeformablePeriodic(ISpace _space)

        Make a cubic boundary of specified edge length and periodicity.

      • BoundaryDeformablePeriodic

        public BoundaryDeformablePeriodic(ISpace space,
                                  IVector[] vex)
        Make a parallelepiped boundary of specified shape and periodicity.
        Parameters:
        space - the governing space
        vex - array of vectors specifying directions for the parallelepiped edges
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the dimension of space is not 2 or 3
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vex.length is not equal to the dimension of the space

    • Method Detail

      • getBoxSize

        public IVector getBoxSize()
        Returns the length of the sides of a rectangular box oriented in the lab frame and in which the boundary is inscribed.

      • getBoundaryTensor

        public Tensor getBoundaryTensor()
        Returns the boundary tensor that fully describes the shape of the boundary. Each column of the tensor is an edge vector of the boundary. Manipulation of the returned tensor does not affect the state of the boundary. Shape-changing methods (e.g., deform()) must be used to affect the boundary shape.

      • centralImage

        public IVector centralImage(IVector r)
        Description copied from interface: IBoundary
        Determines the translation vector needed to apply a periodic-image transformation that moves the given point to an image point within the boundary (if it lies outside, in a direction subject to periodic imaging).
        Parameters:
        r - vector position of untransformed point; r is not changed by this method
        Returns:
        the displacement that must be applied to r to move it to its central-image location

      • nearestImage

        public void nearestImage(IVectorMutable dr)
        Description copied from interface: IBoundary
        The nearest image is the pair of atom images that are closest when all periodic-boundary images are considered. If the vector passed to this method is the displacement vector between two points, the vector will be transformed such that it corresponds to the vector between the nearest image of those two points.

      • deform

        public void deform(Tensor deformationTensor)
        Applies the given deformation tensor to the boundary in its current shape.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the spatial dimension of the tensor is inconsistent with the dimension of the boundary

      • setAsRectangular

        public void setAsRectangular(IVector vector)
        Sets the shape of the boundary as a rectangular parallelepiped (or parallelogram) with edge lengths given by the elements of the given vector. To keep the edge lengths unchanged while deforming into a rectangular shape, call this method with getDimensions() as its argument.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the spatial dimension of the vector is inconsistent with the dimension of the boundary

      • setAsCube

        public void setAsCube(double edgeLength)
        Sets the shape of the boundary to a cube with edges equal to the given value.

      • setBoxSize

        public void setBoxSize(IVector v)
        Scales each boundary edge so that its length equals the corresponding value in the given vector. Deformation of boundary is otherwise unchanged.

      • setEdgeVector

        public void setEdgeVector(int i,
                          IVector v)

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(Tensor t)
        Sets the boundary tensor to equal the given tensor.

        public double volume()
        Specified by:
        volume in interface IBoundary
        Overrides:
        volume in class Boundary
        Returns:
        the volume enclosed by the boundary

      • setTruncationRadius

        public void setTruncationRadius(double newTruncationRadius)

      • getTruncationRadius

        public double getTruncationRadius()

      • update

        protected void update()

      • testTransformVector

        protected void testTransformVector(IVector v)
        We test the given vector (v) to see if 0.5*v would be transformed by any of our existing transformVectors. If so, then we don't need to keep v as an additional transform vector. We also check to see if vectors that would be transformed could be within our truncation radius (if given). If no vector transformed by only v would be within the truncation radius, then v is not included as a new transform vector.

      • getEdgeVector

        public IVector getEdgeVector(int d)
        Description copied from interface: IBoundary
        Returns the vector that defines the edge of this boundary for the given dimension. All vectors returned by this method can be considered to originate from one corner.

      • getPeriodicity

        public boolean getPeriodicity(int i)
        Description copied from interface: IBoundary
        Returns true if the boundary is periodic in the given direction (as defined by the getEdgeVector method).

      • getIndexIterator

        public IndexIteratorSizable getIndexIterator()
        Specified by:
        getIndexIterator in class Boundary

      • imageOrigins

        public double[][] imageOrigins(int nShells)
        Description copied from class: Boundary
        Set of vectors describing the displacements needed to translate the central image to all of the periodic images. The first index specifies each periodic image, while the second index indicates the xyz components of the translation vector.
        Specified by:
        imageOrigins in class Boundary
        Parameters:
        nShells - the number of shells of images to be computed
